16 // decide whether we want C and/or C++ bindings (default matches host language)
17 //
18 // each set of bindings has its own include-once ifdef armor, allowing the
19 // second set of bindings to be loaded even if the first already has been
20 #if !defined(LEGION_ENABLE_C_BINDINGS) && !defined(LEGION_DISABLE_C_BINDINGS)
21  #ifndef __cplusplus
22  #define LEGION_ENABLE_C_BINDINGS
23  #endif
24 #endif
25 #if !defined(LEGION_ENABLE_CXX_BINDINGS) && !defined(LEGION_DISABLE_CXX_BINDINGS)
26  #ifdef __cplusplus
27  #define LEGION_ENABLE_CXX_BINDINGS
28  #endif
29 #endif
30 
31 #ifdef LEGION_ENABLE_C_BINDINGS
32 #include "legion/legion_c.h"
33 #endif
34 
35 #ifdef LEGION_ENABLE_CXX_BINDINGS
36 #ifndef __LEGION_RUNTIME_H__
37 #define __LEGION_RUNTIME_H__

61 #define LEGION_PRINT_ONCE(runtime, ctx, file, fmt, ...) \
62 { \
63  char message[4096]; \
64  snprintf(message, 4096, fmt, ##__VA_ARGS__); \
65  runtime->print_once(ctx, file, message); \
66 }

88  class IndexSpace {
89  public:
90  static const IndexSpace NO_SPACE;
91  protected:
92  // Only the runtime should be allowed to make these
93  FRIEND_ALL_RUNTIME_CLASSES
94  IndexSpace(IndexSpaceID id, IndexTreeID tid, TypeTag tag);
95  public:
96  IndexSpace(void);
97  public:
98  inline bool operator==(const IndexSpace &rhs) const;
99  inline bool operator!=(const IndexSpace &rhs) const;
100  inline bool operator<(const IndexSpace &rhs) const;
101  inline bool operator>(const IndexSpace &rhs) const;
102  inline IndexSpaceID get_id(void) const { return id; }
103  inline IndexTreeID get_tree_id(void) const { return tid; }
104  inline bool exists(void) const { return (id != 0); }
105  inline TypeTag get_type_tag(void) const { return type_tag; }
106  inline int get_dim(void) const;
107  protected:
108  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os,
109  const IndexSpace& is);
110  IndexSpaceID id;
111  IndexTreeID tid;
112  TypeTag type_tag;
113  };

602  class UntypedBuffer : public Unserializable<UntypedBuffer> {
603  public:
604  UntypedBuffer(void) : args(NULL), arglen(0) { }
605  UntypedBuffer(const void *arg, size_t argsize)
606  : args(const_cast<void*>(arg)), arglen(argsize) { }
607  UntypedBuffer(const UntypedBuffer &rhs)
608  : args(rhs.args), arglen(rhs.arglen) { }
609  public:
610  inline size_t get_size(void) const { return arglen; }
611  inline void* get_ptr(void) const { return args; }
612  public:
613  inline bool operator==(const UntypedBuffer &arg) const
614  { return (args == arg.args) && (arglen == arg.arglen); }
615  inline bool operator<(const UntypedBuffer &arg) const
616  { return (args < arg.args) && (arglen < arg.arglen); }
617  inline UntypedBuffer& operator=(const UntypedBuffer &rhs)
618  { args = rhs.args; arglen = rhs.arglen; return *this; }
619  private:
620  void *args;
621  size_t arglen;
622  };
623  // This typedef is here for backwards compatibility since we
624  // used to call an UntypedBuffer a TaskArgument
625  typedef UntypedBuffer TaskArgument;

1049  { return (flags & LEGION_VERIFIED_FLAG); }
1050  inline bool is_no_access(void) const
1051  { return (flags & LEGION_NO_ACCESS_FLAG); }
1052  inline bool is_restricted(void) const
1053  { return (flags & LEGION_RESTRICTED_FLAG); }
1054  inline bool must_premap(void) const
1055  { return (flags & LEGION_MUST_PREMAP_FLAG); }
1056  public:
1057  const void* get_projection_args(size_t *size) const;
1058  void set_projection_args(const void *args, size_t size, bool own = false);
1059  public:
1060 #ifdef LEGION_PRIVILEGE_CHECKS
1061  unsigned get_accessor_privilege(void) const;
1062 #endif
1063  bool has_field_privilege(FieldID fid) const;
1064  public:
1065  // Fields used for controlling task launches
1066  LogicalRegion region;
1067  LogicalPartition partition;
1068  std::set<FieldID> privilege_fields;
1069  std::vector<FieldID> instance_fields;
1070  PrivilegeMode privilege;
1071  CoherenceProperty prop;
1072  LogicalRegion parent;
1073  ReductionOpID redop;
1074  MappingTagID tag;
1075  RegionFlags flags;
1076  public:
1077  ProjectionType handle_type;
1078  ProjectionID projection;
1079  protected:
1080  void *projection_args;
1081  size_t projection_args_size;
1082  };

1396  struct StaticDependence : public Unserializable<StaticDependence> {
1397  public:
1398  StaticDependence(void);
1399  StaticDependence(unsigned previous_offset,
1400  unsigned previous_req_index,
1401  unsigned current_req_index,
1402  DependenceType dtype,
1403  bool validates = false,
1404  bool shard_only = false);
1405  public:
1406  inline void add_field(FieldID fid);
1407  public:
1408  // The relative offset from this operation to
1409  // previous operation in the stream of operations
1410  // (e.g. 1 is the operation launched immediately before)
1411  unsigned previous_offset;
1412  // Region requirement of the previous operation for the dependence
1413  unsigned previous_req_index;
1414  // Region requirement of the current operation for the dependence
1415  unsigned current_req_index;
1416  // The type of the dependence
1417  DependenceType dependence_type;
1418  // Whether this requirement validates the previous writer
1419  bool validates;
1420  // Whether this dependence is a shard-only dependence for
1421  // control replication or it depends on all other copies
1422  bool shard_only;
1423  // Fields that have the dependence
1424  std::set<FieldID> dependent_fields;
1425  };

1434  struct TaskLauncher {
1435  public:
1436  TaskLauncher(void);
1437  TaskLauncher(TaskID tid,
1438  UntypedBuffer arg,
1439  Predicate pred = Predicate::TRUE_PRED,
1440  MapperID id = 0,
1441  MappingTagID tag = 0,
1442  UntypedBuffer map_arg = UntypedBuffer());
1443  public:
1444  inline IndexSpaceRequirement&
1445  add_index_requirement(const IndexSpaceRequirement &req);
1446  inline RegionRequirement&
1447  add_region_requirement(const RegionRequirement &req);
1448  inline void add_field(unsigned idx, FieldID fid, bool inst = true);
1449  public:
1450  inline void add_future(Future f);
1451  inline void add_grant(Grant g);
1452  inline void add_wait_barrier(PhaseBarrier bar);
1453  inline void add_arrival_barrier(PhaseBarrier bar);
1454  inline void add_wait_handshake(LegionHandshake handshake);
1455  inline void add_arrival_handshake(LegionHandshake handshake);
1456  public:
1457  inline void set_predicate_false_future(Future f);
1458  inline void set_predicate_false_result(UntypedBuffer arg);
1459  public:
1460  inline void set_independent_requirements(bool independent);
1461  public:
1462  TaskID task_id;
1463  std::vector<IndexSpaceRequirement> index_requirements;
1464  std::vector<RegionRequirement> region_requirements;
1465  std::vector<Future> futures;
1466  std::vector<Grant> grants;
1467  std::vector<PhaseBarrier> wait_barriers;
1468  std::vector<PhaseBarrier> arrive_barriers;
1469  UntypedBuffer argument;
1470  Predicate predicate;
1471  MapperID map_id;
1472  MappingTagID tag;
1473  UntypedBuffer map_arg;
1474  DomainPoint point;
1475  // Only used in control replication contexts for
1476  // doing sharding. If left unspecified the runtime
1477  // will use an index space of size 1 containing 'point'
1478  IndexSpace sharding_space;
1479  public:
1480  // If the predicate is set to anything other than
1481  // Predicate::TRUE_PRED, then the application must
1482  // specify a value for the future in the case that
1483  // the predicate resolves to false. UntypedBuffer(NULL,0)
1484  // can be used if the task's return type is void.
1485  Future predicate_false_future;
1486  UntypedBuffer predicate_false_result;
1487  public:
1488  // Inform the runtime about any static dependences
1489  // These will be ignored outside of static traces
1490  const std::vector<StaticDependence> *static_dependences;
1491  public:
1492  // Users can tell the runtime this task is eligible
1493  // for inlining by the mapper. This will invoke the
1494  // select_task_options call inline as part of the launch
1495  // logic for this task to allow the mapper to decide
1496  // whether to inline the task or not. Note that if the
1497  // mapper pre-empts during execution then resuming it
1498  // may take a long time if another long running task
1499  // gets scheduled on the processor that launched this task.
1500  bool enable_inlining;
1501  public:
1502  // In some cases users (most likely compilers) will want
1503  // to run a light-weight function (e.g. a continuation)
1504  // as a task that just depends on futures once those futures
1505  // are ready on a local processor where the parent task
1506  // is executing. We call this a local function task and it
1507  // must not have any region requirements. It must als be a
1508  // pure function with no side effects. This task will
1509  // not have the option of being distributed to remote nodes.
1510  bool local_function_task;
1511  public:
1512  // Users can inform the runtime that all region requirements
1513  // are independent of each other in this task. Independent
1514  // means that either field sets are independent or region
1515  // requirements are disjoint based on the region tree.
1516  bool independent_requirements;
1517  public:
1518  // Instruct the runtime that it does not need to produce
1519  // a future or future map result for this index task
1520  bool elide_future_return;
1521  public:
1522  bool silence_warnings;
1523  };

7477  public:
7478  //------------------------------------------------------------------------
7479  // Control Replication
7480  // In general SPMD-style programming in Legion is wrong. If you find
7481  // yourself writing SPMD-style code for large fractions of your program
7482  // then you're probably doing something wrong. There are a few exceptions:
7483  // 1. index attach/detach operations are collective and may need
7484  // to do per-shard work
7485  // 2. I/O in general often needs to do per-shard work
7486  // 3. interaction with collective frameworks like MPI and NCCL
7487  // 4. others?
7488  // For these reasons we allow users to get access to their shard ID and
7489  // the total number of shards and to make a future map collectively
7490  // Please, please, please be careful with how you use them
7491  //------------------------------------------------------------------------
7499  ShardID local_shard(Context ctx);
7500 
7508  size_t total_shards(Context ctx);
